intro: Paronychia eosina, commonly known as the red sandthorn, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its small, red berries that contain a single seed. The plant typically grows in shrubland and coastal areas, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are opposite and ovate, with a hairy texture, while its flowers are small and clustered. Paronychia eosina is often used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
